snippet: The leader of Hezbollah edged closer to acknowledging that its fighters were battling rebels in Syria, an intervention that threatens to drag Lebanon deeper into that conflict.
abstract: Hassan Nasrallah, leader of Lebanese Shiite organization Hezbollah, during televised speech, edges closer to acknowledging that organization's fighters are battling rebels in neighboring Syria; warns that Hezbollah could become more involved in conflict in future.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HANIA MOURTADA

lead_paragraph: The leader of Hezbollah edged closer to acknowledging that its fighters were battling rebels in Syria, an intervention that threatens to drag Lebanon deeper into that conflict.

headline.seo: Nasrallah Warns That Hezbollah Is Ready to Come to Syria’s Aid
headline.main: Leader of Hezbollah Warns It Is Ready to Come to Syria’s Aid
headline.print_headline: Leader of Hezbollah Warns It Is Ready to Come to Syria’s Aid

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
